intro: Monenteles forsteri, commonly known as the Forster's monentelle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
